members.member: Currently these values are duplicated in $\Sql\ssms\smo\SMO\Main\src\enumerations.cs Eventually we would like to remove the type defined there (see TFS#7818885) but until that happens make sure to update both enums with any changes *
The server is Personal or standard
The server is a Sql Managed Instance

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes
member.remarks: Statement execution constants are used to direct the behavior of the ExecuteImmediate method, altering execution behavior or interpretation of the statement submitted for execution

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.Default
member.summary: No statement execution options set

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.NoCommands
member.summary: Ignore the command terminator in the script. Execute as a single batch

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.ContinueOnError
member.summary: Batch execution continues on any error that does not break the connection

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.NoExec
member.summary: Execute SET NOEXEC ON prior to batch execution. Execute SET NOEXEC OFF after batch execution.

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.ParseOnly
member.summary: Execute SET PARSEONLY ON prior to batch execution. Execute SET PARSEONLY OFF after batch execution

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes.QuotedIdentifierOn
member.summary: Execute SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER ON prior to batch execution. Execute SET QUOTED_IDENTIFIER OFF after batch execution.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.SqlExecutionModes
member.summary: Determines if SQL statements are captured or sent to the server.

member.summary: execute sql

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.SqlExecutionModes.CaptureSql
member.summary: sql is captured

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.SqlExecutionModes.ExecuteAndCaptureSql
member.summary: sql is executed and captured

member.summary: TBD

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ThrowIfUpdatesAreBlocked
member.summary: check that we are not already connected

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ThrowIfInvalidValue(System.String,System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: check if the input value is valid ( != null )
member.param: string to be checked

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ThrowIfInvalidValue(System.Int32,System.Int32,System.String)
member.summary: check if the input value is valid ( > 0 )
member.param: integer to be checked

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.GetConnectionString
member.summary: builds the connection string

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.SetAuthentication(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder)
member.summary: Set Authentication using reflection

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.SetApplicationIntent(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnectionStringBuilder)
member.summary: Set the ApplicationIntent of the SqlConnectionStringBuilder. If the property is not supported or we have an invalid ApplicationIntent the value is ignored.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ServerInstance
member.summary: The name of the SQL Server the object will connect to. If not set, the local server is implied. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.IsLoginInitialized
member.summary: true if Login property has been initialized

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.Login
member.summary: The SQL Server Login name that is used to connect to the server. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException PropertyNotSetException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.IsPasswordInitialized
member.summary: true if Password property has been initialized

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.Password
member.summary: The password that is used with Login to connect to the server. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException PropertyNotSetException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.SecurePassword
member.summary: The password that is used with Login to connect to the server. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException PropertyNotSetException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.LoginSecure
member.summary: If set to true, Windows integrate security is used and Login and Password are ignored. If not set, Sql Server Authentication is used. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ConnectAsUserName
member.summary: Specifies the NT user that is used when creating an impersonated connection. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException PropertyNotSetException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ConnectAsUserPassword
member.summary: Specifies password of the NT user that is used when creating an impersonated connection. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException PropertyNotSetException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ConnectAsUser
member.summary: If set to true, the connection will be made with the credentials of the specified user. This will assume impersonation, however the LoginSecure flags and Login and Password fields will not be affected. ConnectionCannotBeChangedException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.NonPooledConnection
member.summary: By default, all connections to SQL Server are taken from an ADO.NET connection pool.If set to true, this allows users to create a non-pooled connection (will not be reused when closed). Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.PooledConnectionLifetime
member.summary: When a connection is returned to the pool, its creation time is compared with the current time, and the connection is destroyed if that time span (in seconds) exceeds the value specified by connection lifetime. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.MinPoolSize
member.summary: The minimum number of connections maintained in the pool. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.MaxPoolSize
member.summary: The maximum number of connections allowed in the pool. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ConnectTimeout
member.summary: The length of time (in seconds) to wait for a connection to the server before terminating the attempt and throwing an exception. Default is 30 seconds (same as Shiloh). Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.Authentication
member.summary: The authentication type of the connection

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ApplicationIntent
member.summary: The application intent of the connection Valid values are ReadWrite and ReadOnly

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.TrustServerCertificate
member.summary: Indicate whether the client trusts the server certificate

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ConnectionString
member.summary: The property will return either the user specified connection string or it will return the computed connection string based on object settings. If explicitly set, All properties in the ServerConnection object will be populated to reflect the passed in connection string. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.SecureConnectionString
member.summary: The property will return a SecureString version of either the user specified connection string or it will return the computed connection string based on object settings. If explicitly set, All properties in the ServerConnection object will be populated to reflect the passed in connection string. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.NetworkProtocol
member.summary: Identifies the client network protocol that is used to connect to SQL Server. If you do not specify a network and you use a local server, shared memory is used. If you do not specify a network and you use a remote server, the one of the configured client protocols is used. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.IsApplicationNameInitialized
member.summary: true if ApplicationName property has been initialized

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ApplicationName
member.summary: The name of the application. 'SQL Management' if no application name has been provided. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.IsWorkstationIdInitialized
member.summary: true if WorkstationId property has been initialized

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.WorkstationId
member.summary: The name of the workstation connecting to SQL Server. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.IsDatabaseNameInitialized
member.summary: true if DatabaseName property has been initialized

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.DatabaseName
member.summary: TBD

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.PacketSize
member.summary: Size in bytes of the network packets used to communicate with an instance of SQL Server. Default is 8192. Exceptions: ConnectionCannotBeChangedException InvalidPropertyValueException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.MultipleActiveResultSets
member.summary: Enable MARS from the connection. Default is false.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.EncryptConnection
member.summary: whether "encrypt=true" is specified in the connection string

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.AdditionalParameters
member.summary: Returns whether additional parameters have been specified in connection string

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.InitialCatalog
member.summary: Gets the InitialCatalog.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionSettings.ResetConnectionString
member.summary: Tells us whether ConnectionString needs to be reset in SqlConnectionObject property of ConnectionManager or not.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.#ctor
member.summary: TBD

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.#ctor(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.IRenewableToken)
member.summary: Constructor. Initialize properties by using information from parameter sqlConnectionObject. If the status of sqlConnectionObject is Open, also query server for @@LOCK_TIMEOUT to set the LockTimeout property.
member.param: SqlConnection

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.InitSqlConnectionObject(System.Boolean,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Initialize the SqlConnection object.
member.param: if ConnectionString needs to be set.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.GetWindowsIdentityForConnection
member.summary: if impersonation is required return the identity to be impersonated else returns null

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.InternalConnect(System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity)
member.summary: connects to the server impersonating if necessary ( if null != impersonatedIdentity )

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.Connect
member.summary: Creates the actual connection to SQL Server. Ignored if already connected. It is optional to call this method, as the connection will be opened when required. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ExecuteTSql(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ExecuteTSqlAction,System.Object,System.Data.DataSet,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes T-SQL using the appropriate methods depending on the action information passed as the parameter.
member.param: Defines method to be used for executing T-SQL
Object on which that method needs to be called
DataSet in which data need to filled in case of SqlDataAdapter execObject
If the exception to be caught.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.IsDatabaseValid(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlConnection,System.String)
member.summary: Verifies that a given database exists

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.CheckServerVersion(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerVersion)
member.summary: Check if we are connecting to a supported server version. block off <= 7.0 in ServerConnection.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.Disconnect
member.summary: Closes the connection with SQL Server. Ignored if already disconnected. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.PoolConnect
member.summary: connects only if not already connected

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.PoolDisconnect
member.summary: disconnects only if it is pooled

member.name: F:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.statementEventHandler
member.summary: Event that is called each time a T-SQL statement has been executed and capture is set This allows users to add a event hook to trace T-SQL statements.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ForceDisconnected
member.summary: Enforces a disconnect and ensures that connection cannot be re-opened again

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.InUse
member.summary: Returns true if the object has been connected with the server at least once. If true, property changes are not allowed any more and ConnectionCannotBeChangedException will be thrown when a property has been changed.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.LockTimeout
member.summary: LockTimeout is the Lock timeout in seconds. Default -1 is for indefinite. InvalidPropertyValueException is thrown for all other negative numbers. Positive LockTimeout will be multiplied by 1000 and then used for "SET LOCK_TIMEOUT" setting.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ServerVersion
member.summary: Returns the major version number of SQL Server. I.e. 8 for SQL Server 2000. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ProductVersion
member.summary: Gets the ProductVersion server property of this connection

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.DatabaseEngineType
member.summary: Returns the database engine type of SQL Server. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.DatabaseEngineEdition
member.summary: The edition of the Database Engine

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.HostPlatform
member.summary: The host platform of the server (Linux/Windows/etc)

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ConnectionProtocol
member.summary: Connection protocol.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.IsContainedAuthentication
member.summary: Returns true if the database engine authenticates using contained authentication. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.SqlConnectionObject
member.summary: Returns a reference to the SqlConnection object used by the ConnectionContext object. This should always return the valid sqlConnection object with the latest valid ConnectionString set. Exceptions: PropertyNotAvailableException

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.CurrentDatabase
member.summary: Returns the current database context.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.IsOpen
member.summary: Returns true if the SqlConnection object is connected with the server. This can only return true for non pooled connections as pooled connections are always closed directly after an operation.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.StateChange
member.summary: Occurs when the state of the connection changes. Uses System.Data.StateChangeEventHandler.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.InfoMessage
member.summary: Occurs when SQL Server returns a warning or informational message. Uses System.Data.SqlClient.SqlInfoMessageEventHandler.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ServerMessage
member.summary: Occurs when SQL Server returns a warning or informational message. Uses System.Data.SqlClient.SqlInfoMessageEventHandler.

member.name: E:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.RemoteLoginFailed
member.summary: Called when the server needs to connect to remote servers and the login fails

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.IsForceDisconnected
member.summary: Indicates that the connection has been forcefully disconnected

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ConnectionManager.ExecuteTSqlAction
member.summary: Defines all the Methods used to Execute T-SQL on a server in the ServerConnection object.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.EncryptionUtility
member.summary: Utility methods for working with SecureStrings

member.summary: Decrypt a SecureString
member.param: The secure string to decrypt

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.EncryptionUtility.EncryptString(System.String)
member.summary: Encrypt a string
member.param: The string to encrypt

member.summary: General utility methods.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.CommonUtils.MakeSqlBraket(System.String)
member.summary: Makes the string a SQL identifier.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.CommonUtils.MakeSqlString(System.String)
member.summary: Makes the string a unicode sql string.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2
member.summary:
ExecutionCache is a simple cache that manages cached items. The cache holds up to #capacity# number of items and will remove the first item it added to the cache when it is full.
It is intent to be used by a single thread.
Implementation note: The access time is linear to the number of item in the cache. The cache is initially extracted from ServerConnection such that the cache and item management can be unit tested thoughtfully without configuration. It is not designed to be a widely-used cache utilities class. It is generalized for testability.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.#ctor(System.Int32)
member.summary: Constructor.
member.param: The capacity of the cache. If item is added when the cache is full, the first item of the cache will be evicted.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.ContainsKey(`0)
member.summary: Returns true of the cache contains an item with the specified key.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.Add(`1)
member.summary: Add a cache item into the cache. The item must have a unique key. The item and key must not be null.
member.param: Item to be added
member.exception: Throws to indicate another item in the cache has the same key as the specified item

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.ClearResults
member.summary: Clear results in all cache items.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.Clear
member.summary: Clear the cache.

member.summary: Report if the cache is empty.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.Item(`0)
member.summary: Obtain the cache item with the specified key.

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionCache`2.Count
member.summary: Report the number of item in the cache.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.CacheItem`1
member.summary:
CacheItem is a item container for the payloads identified the same key.
The CacheItem has three specific concepts, Key, Result and ExecutionCount. Each item is identified by its key, and it must be unique. Adding non-unique item to the cache results in exception.
The Result and ExecutionCount is specific payload that a CacheItem supports. The result distinguishes between null result and no result by hasResult(). ExecutionCount is nothing more than a manual counter. Sub-class of CacheItem can add more payload that suite the purpose of them.

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ICommonDynamicVisible
member.summary:
The ICommonDynamicVisible interface should be implemented by any class that wants to limit the visibility of certain Enum values based on state of the class at that moment.
If a class contains a property which exposes an Enum and that class implements the ICommonDynamicVisible interface then it will be called for each property that is of an Enum type.
The context param can be used to determine for which Enum this method is being called. If a class only has one Enum it is not necessary to make this check.
The way to limit the visibility of certain items is to simply remove the unwanted Enum values from the values ArrayList. This method is called on every drop down of the enum so it is possible to change the list on each and every drop down. If the list will not change once it has been initially determined caching the ArrayList and returning it would be helpful.
Care should be taken to ensure that you are not removing values that the Enum property is already set to. This will not cause any errors as all Enum values are still valid but when the user clicks on the dropdown they will not see the current choice as an option.
Also no new values should be added to the list since these values will not be convertable to valid Enum values and an error will be thrown at runtime. If more dynamic control is needed then consider using the DynamicValues design.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ICommonDynamicVisible.ConfigureVisibleEnumFields(System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext,System.Collections.ArrayList)
member.summary:
Removing items from the values list and returning that new list will control the values shown in the Enum specified in context.
The enum can be determined with code similar to the following if (context.PropertyDescriptor.PropertyType == typeof(myEnum))

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.NormalizeQuery(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Translate a query with embedded literals to a normalized form (all literals replaced by a standard token)
member.remarks:
Examples:
SELECT * FROM table WHERE column = 123
becomes:
SELECT * FROM table WHERE column = ?
SELECT * FROM table WHERE column = 'foo'
becomes:
SELECT * FROM table WHERE column = '?'
member.param: Query text to normalize
Switch indicating whether query text expects QUOTED_IDENTIFER to be enabled
member.returns: Query text with inline literals translated to ? symbols

members.member: Temporary function needed as long as the sql enumerator is unaware of the SqlStoreConnection type

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in the StringCollection. The command termininator ('GO') is recognized by ExecuteNonQuery. Batches separated with the GO statement will be sent and executed individually. The statement is recorded and not executed if CaptureMode has been set to true. An array of int values is returned that contain the numbers of rows affected for each statement in the StringCollection. If multiple batches are executed, the total numbers of affected rows of all batches is returned. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteNonQuery(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in the StringCollection. The command termininator ('GO') is recognized by ExecuteNonQuery. Batches separated with the GO statement will be sent and executed individually. The statement is recorded and not executed if CaptureMode has been set to true. An array of int values is returned that contain the numbers of rows affected for each statement in the StringCollection. If multiple batches are executed, the total numbers of affected rows of all batches is returned. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: Whether we should retry if an exception is thrown during execution

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes)
member.summary: Executes a T-SQL statement. The command termininator ('GO') is recognized by ExecuteNonQuery. Batches will be sent and executed individually. The statement is recorded and not executed if CaptureMode has been set to true. An int value is returned that contain the numbers of rows affected. If multiple batches are executed, the total numbers of affected rows of all batches is returned. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteNonQuery(System.String,Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ExecutionTypes,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes a T-SQL statement. The command termininator ('GO') is recognized by ExecuteNonQuery. Batches will be sent and executed individually. The statement is recorded and not executed if CaptureMode has been set to true. An int value is returned that contain the numbers of rows affected. If multiple batches are executed, the total numbers of affected rows of all batches is returned. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: Whether we should retry if an exception is thrown during execution

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteWithResults(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in the StringCollection. An array of DataSets are returned that contain the results for each statement in the StringCollection. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteWithResults(System.String)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in sqlCommand. A DataSet is returned that contains the results. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteWithResults(System.String,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in sqlCommand. A DataSet is returned that contains the results. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: Whether we should retry if an exception is thrown during execution

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteReader(System.String)
member.summary: Executes T-SQL statements. A SqlDataReader object is returned that can be used to read the stream of rows that are returned by SQL Server. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. it doesn't automatically disconnect Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: The SQL command text.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteReader(System.String,System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand@)
member.summary: Executes T-SQL statements. A SqlDataReader object is returned that can be used to read the stream of rows that are returned by SQL Server. A SqlCommand object is also returned that can be used to cancel the data reader pipe if an abort of a long-running query is needed. it doesn't automatically disconnect Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: The SQL command text.
The resulting SqlCommand object for data reader pipe cancellation.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Executes T-SQL statements. A SqlDataReader object is returned that can be used to read the stream of rows that are returned by SQL Server. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception
member.param: SQL command object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.GetExecuteReader(System.Data.SqlClient.SqlCommand)
member.summary: Returns a SqlDataReader with an active connection.
member.param: Ready to execute sqlcommand object.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteScalar(System.Collections.Specialized.StringCollection)
member.summary: Executes the T-SQL statements in the StringCollection. An array of objects are returned that each contain the first column of the first row of the result set of each executed statement. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.ExecuteScalar(System.String)
member.summary: Executes a T-SQL statement. An objects is returned that contains the first column of the first row of the result set. The Connect() method will be called if the connection with the server is not open. Exceptions: ConnectionFailureException ExecutionFailureExeception

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.BeginTransaction
member.summary: Starts a new transaction. If CaptureMode is true, the transaction statement will be added to the capture buffer.It is possible to nest transactions. It is the user's responsibility to commit or rollback every opened transaction. It is not guaranteed that all T-SQL emitted by the object model, can be encapsulated by a transaction. Furthermore, the state of the objects that have been changed will not reflect the actual database state until a transaction has been committed or after a transaction has been rolled backed. It is the responsibility of the user to refresh affected objects. Use with care.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.CommitTransaction
member.summary: Commits a transaction. If CaptureMode is true, the transaction command will be added to the capture buffer. Exceptions: NotInTransactionException

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.RollBackTransaction
member.summary: Aborts a transaction (all changes made will not be saved to the database). If CaptureMode is true, the transaction command will be added to the capture buffer. Exceptions: NotInTransactionException

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.IsInFixedServerRole(Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.FixedServerRoles)

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.BatchSeparator

member.name: P:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.ServerConnection.TransactionDepth

member.name: T:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.WindowsCredential
member.summary: Enables storage and retrieval of passwords from Windows Credential Manager, keyed by connection type and user name

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.WindowsCredential.GetKey(System.String,System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Guid)
member.summary: Here are factors influencing the choice of key: 1. SSMS stores the list of saved connections in a versioned file, for both connection dialog and registered servers. If in SSMS 19 we decide we want to use the same credentials as 18, we can change this code to use the 18 instead of the SSMSMajorVersionString. Having a version allows us to change the semantic in the future, perhaps by encoding the entire blob in the store and enumerating all the credentials from there instead of from the BIN file. 2. There are multiple saved connection lists - SSMS registered servers, SqlRepl Ui registered servers, SSMS connection dialog. We have a repo name for each of those lists. 3. All the lists have groupings by server type, auth type, and user name. 4. We want it to be human readable so users can edit the passwords using the Windows ui if desired. Unfortunately the Windows UI truncates the key name in the display but that's beyond our control. The user has to hover over the name to see the full text in a tooltip.

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.WindowsCredential.GetAdsKey(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Returns a key for Azure Data Studio credential

member.name: M:Microsoft.SqlServer.Management.Common.WindowsCredential.SetSqlSsmsCredential(System.String,System.Int32,System.String,System.Guid,System.Security.SecureString)
member.summary: Stores the password for the given SSMS saved connection in Windows Credential Manager
member.param: The server name
The type of authentication used by the connection. The meaning of the value depends on the
The user name
The type of server connection. The valid values are application dependent.
The password
member.exception: Thrown when saving the password fails

The password
